     46 const size_t kMinSkip = 250;
     47 const int kMinFilterRatio = 50;
     48 const int kMaxScan        = (1 << 20);

     50 DEFINE_bool(index, true, "Create a suffix-array index to speed searches.");
     51 DEFINE_bool(compress, true, "Compress file contents linewise");
     52 DEFINE_bool(drop_cache, false, "Drop caches before each search");
     53 DEFINE_bool(search, true, "Actually do the search.");
     54 DEFINE_int32(timeout, 1000, "The number of milliseconds a single search may run for.");
     55 DEFINE_int32(threads, 4, "Number of threads to use.");
     56 DEFINE_int32(line_limit, 1024, "Maximum line length to index.");

     58 namespace {
     59     metric idx_bytes("index.bytes");
     60     metric idx_bytes_dedup("index.bytes.dedup");
     61     metric idx_files("index.files");
     62     metric idx_lines("index.lines");
     63     metric idx_lines_dedup("index.lines.dedup");
     64     metric idx_data_chunks("index.data.chunks");
     65     metric idx_content_chunks("index.content.chunks");
     66     metric idx_content_ranges("index.content.ranges");

     69 #ifdef __APPLE__
     70 /*
     71  * Reverse memchr()
     72  * Find the last occurrence of 'c' in the buffer 's' of size 'n'.
     73  */
     74 void *
     75 memrchr(const void *s,
     76         int c,
     77         size_t n)
     78 {
     79     const unsigned char *cp;
     80 
     81     if (n != 0) {
     82 	cp = (unsigned char *)s + n;
     83 	do {
     84 	    if (*(--cp) == (unsigned char)c)
     85 		return (void *)cp;
     86 	} while (--n != 0);
     87     }
     88     return (void *)0;
     89 }
     90 #endif
     91 
     92 size_t hashstr::operator()(const StringPiece& str) const {
     93     return absl::Hash<absl::string_view>{}(absl::string_view(str.data(), str.size()));
     94 }
     95 
     96 const StringPiece empty_string(NULL, 0);
     97 
     98 class search_limiter {
     99 public:
    100     search_limiter(int query_max_matches) : matches_(0), max_matches_(query_max_matches), exit_reason_(kExitNone) {
    101         if (FLAGS_timeout <= 0) {
    102             deadline_.tv_sec = numeric_limits<time_t>::max();
    103         } else {
    104             timeval timeout = {
    105                 0, FLAGS_timeout * 1000
    106             }, now;
    107             gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
    108             timeval_add(&deadline_, &now, &timeout);
    109         }
    110     }
    111 
    112     exit_reason why() {
    113         return exit_reason_;
    114     }
    115 
    116     bool exit_early() {
    117         if (exit_reason_)
    118             return true;
    119 
    120 #ifdef CODESEARCH_SLOWGTOD
    121         static int counter = 1000;
    122         if (--counter)
    123             return false;
    124         counter = 1000;
    125 #endif
    126         timeval now;
    127         gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
    128         if (now.tv_sec > deadline_.tv_sec ||
    129             (now.tv_sec == deadline_.tv_sec && now.tv_usec > deadline_.tv_usec)) {
    130             exit_reason_ = kExitTimeout;
    131             return true;
    132         }
    133         return false;
    134     }
    135 
    136     void record_match() {
    137         int matches = ++matches_;
    138         if (exit_reason_)
    139             return;
    140         if (max_matches_ && matches >= max_matches_) {
    141             exit_reason_ = kExitMatchLimit;
    142         }
    143     }
    144 
    145 protected:
    146     atomic_int matches_;
    147     int max_matches_;
    148     timeval deadline_;
    149     exit_reason exit_reason_;
    150 };
    151 
    152 class code_searcher;
    153 struct match_finger;
    154 
    155 bool accept(const query *q, const indexed_file *file) {
    156     if (q->file_pat &&
    157         !q->file_pat->Match(file->path, 0, file->path.size(),
    158                             RE2::UNANCHORED, 0, 0))
    159         return false;
    160 
    161     if (q->tree_pat &&
    162         !q->tree_pat->Match(file->tree->name, 0,
    163                             file->tree->name.size(),
    164                             RE2::UNANCHORED, 0, 0))
    165         return false;
    166 
    167     if (q->negate.file_pat &&
    168         q->negate.file_pat->Match(file->path, 0,
    169                                   file->path.size(),
    170                                   RE2::UNANCHORED, 0, 0))
    171         return false;
    172 
    173     if (q->negate.tree_pat &&
    174         q->negate.tree_pat->Match(file->tree->name, 0,
    175                                   file->tree->name.size(),
    176                                   RE2::UNANCHORED, 0, 0))
    177         return false;
    178 
    179     return true;
    180 }
    181 
    182 bool accept(const query *q, const list<indexed_file *> &sfs) {
    183     for (list<indexed_file *>::const_iterator it = sfs.begin();
    184          it != sfs.end(); ++it) {
    185         if (accept(q, *it))
    186             return true;
    187     }
    188     return false;
    189 }
    190 
    191 class searcher {
    192 public:
    193     searcher(const code_searcher *cc,
    194              const query &q,
    195              const intrusive_ptr<QueryPlan> index_key,
    196              const code_searcher::search_thread::transform_func& func) :
    197         cc_(cc), query_(&q), transform_(func), queue_(),
    198         limiter_(q.max_matches), index_key_(index_key), re2_time_(false),
    199         git_time_(false), index_time_(false), sort_time_(false),
    200         analyze_time_(false), files_(cc->files_.size(), 0xff),
    201         files_density_(-1)
    202     {}
    203 
    204     ~searcher() {
    205         debug(kDebugProfile, "re2 time: %d.%06ds",
    206               int(re2_time_.elapsed().tv_sec),
    207               int(re2_time_.elapsed().tv_usec));
    208         debug(kDebugProfile, "git time: %d.%06ds",
    209               int(git_time_.elapsed().tv_sec),
    210               int(git_time_.elapsed().tv_usec));
    211         debug(kDebugProfile, "index time: %d.%06ds",
    212               int(index_time_.elapsed().tv_sec),
    213               int(index_time_.elapsed().tv_usec));
    214         debug(kDebugProfile, "sort time: %d.%06ds",
    215               int(sort_time_.elapsed().tv_sec),
    216               int(sort_time_.elapsed().tv_usec));
    217     }
    218 
    219     void operator()(const chunk *chunk);
    220 
    221     void get_stats(match_stats *stats) {
    222         struct timeval t;
    223 
    224         t = re2_time_.elapsed();
    225         timeradd(&stats->re2_time, &t, &stats->re2_time);
    226 
    227         t = git_time_.elapsed();
    228         timeradd(&stats->git_time, &t, &stats->git_time);
    229 
    230         t = index_time_.elapsed();
    231         timeradd(&stats->index_time, &t, &stats->index_time);
    232 
    233         t = sort_time_.elapsed();
    234         timeradd(&stats->sort_time , &t, &stats->sort_time);
    235 
    236         t = analyze_time_.elapsed();
    237         timeradd(&stats->analyze_time, &t, &stats->analyze_time);
    238     }
    239 
    240     exit_reason why() {
    241         return limiter_.why();
    242     }
    243 
    244 protected:
    245     void next_range(match_finger *finger, int& minpos, int& maxpos, int end);
    246     bool should_search_chunk(const chunk *chunk);
    247     void full_search(const chunk *chunk);
    248     void full_search(match_finger *finger, const chunk *chunk,
    249                      size_t minpos, size_t maxpos);
    250 
    251     void filtered_search(const chunk *chunk);
    252     void search_lines(uint32_t *left, int count, const chunk *chunk);
    253 
    254     double files_density(void) {
    255         std::unique_lock<std::mutex> locked(mtx_);
    256         if (files_density_ >= 0)
    257             return files_density_;
    258 
    259         int hits = 0;
    260         int sample = min(1000, int(cc_->files_.size()));
    261         for (int i = 0; i < sample; i++) {
    262             if (accept(query_, cc_->files_[rand() % cc_->files_.size()].get()))
    263                 hits++;
    264         }
    265         return (files_density_ = double(hits) / sample);
    266     }
    267 
    268     /*
    269      * Do a linear walk over chunk->files, searching for all files
    270 p     * which contain `match', which is contained within `line'.
    271      */
    272     void find_match_brute(const chunk *chunk,
    273                           const StringPiece& match,
    274                           const StringPiece& line);
    275 
    276     /*
    277      * Given a match `match', contained within `line', find all files
    278      * that contain that match. If indexing is enabled, do this by
    279      * walking the chunk_file BST; Otherwise, fall back on a
    280      * brute-force linear walk.
    281      */
    282     void find_match(const chunk *chunk,
    283                     const StringPiece& match,
    284                     const StringPiece& line);
    285 
    286     /*
    287      * Given a matching substring, its containing line, and a search
    288      * file, determine whether that file actually contains that line,
    289      * and if so, post results to queue_
    290      */
    291     void try_match(const StringPiece&,
    292                    const StringPiece&,
    293                    indexed_file *);
    294 
    295     static int line_start(const chunk *chunk, int pos) {
    296         const unsigned char *start = static_cast<const unsigned char*>
    297             (memrchr(chunk->data, '\n', pos));
    298         if (start == NULL)
    299             return 0;
    300         return start - chunk->data;
    301     }
    302 
    303     static int line_end(const chunk *chunk, int pos) {
    304         const unsigned char *end = static_cast<const unsigned char*>
    305             (memchr(chunk->data + pos, '\n', chunk->size - pos));
    306         if (end == NULL)
    307             return chunk->size;
    308         return end - chunk->data;
    309     }
    310 
    311     static StringPiece find_line(const StringPiece& chunk, const StringPiece& match) {
    312         const char *start, *end;
    313         assert(match.data() >= chunk.data());
    314         assert(match.data() <= chunk.data() + chunk.size());
    315         assert(match.size() <= (chunk.size() - (match.data() - chunk.data())));
    316         start = static_cast<const char*>
    317             (memrchr(chunk.data(), '\n', match.data() - chunk.data()));
    318         if (start == NULL)
    319             start = chunk.data();
    320         else
    321             start++;
    322         end = static_cast<const char*>
    323             (memchr(match.data() + match.size(), '\n',
    324                     chunk.size() - (match.data() - chunk.data()) - match.size()));
    325         if (end == NULL)
    326             end = chunk.data() + chunk.size();
    327         return StringPiece(start, end - start);
    328     }
    329 
    330     const code_searcher *cc_;
    331     const query *query_;
    332     const code_searcher::search_thread::transform_func transform_;
    333     thread_queue<match_result*> queue_;
    334     search_limiter limiter_;
    335     intrusive_ptr<QueryPlan> index_key_;
    336     timer re2_time_;
    337     timer git_time_;
    338     timer index_time_;
    339     timer sort_time_;
    340     timer analyze_time_;
    341     vector<uint8_t> files_;
    342 
    343     /*
    344      * The approximate ratio of how many files match file_pat and
    345      * tree_pat. Lazily computed -- -1 means it hasn't been computed
    346      * yet. Protected by mtx_.
    347      */
    348     double files_density_;
    349     std::mutex mtx_;
    350 
    351     friend class code_searcher::search_thread;
    352 };
    353 
    354 class filename_searcher {
    355 public:
    356     filename_searcher(const code_searcher *cc,
    357                       const query &q,
    358                       intrusive_ptr<QueryPlan> index_key) :
    359         cc_(cc), query_(&q), index_key_(index_key), queue_(), limiter_(q.max_matches)
    360     {}
    361 
    362     void operator()();
    363 
    364     exit_reason why() {
    365         return limiter_.why();
    366     }
    367 
    368 protected:
    369     void match_filename(indexed_file *file);
    370 
    371     const code_searcher *cc_;
    372     const query *query_;
    373     intrusive_ptr<QueryPlan> index_key_;
    374     thread_queue<file_result*> queue_;
    375     search_limiter limiter_;
    376 
    377     friend class code_searcher::search_thread;
    378 };
    379 
    380 int suffix_search(const unsigned char *data,
    381                   const uint32_t *suffixes,
    382                   int size,
    383                   intrusive_ptr<QueryPlan> index,
    384                   vector<uint32_t> &indexes_out);
    385 
    386 void filename_searcher::operator()()
    387 {
    388     static per_thread<vector<uint32_t> > indexes;
    389     if (!indexes.get()) {
    390         indexes.put(new vector<uint32_t>(cc_->filename_data_.size() / kMinFilterRatio / 10));
    391     }
    392 
    393     int count = suffix_search(cc_->filename_data_.data(),
    394                               cc_->filename_suffixes_.data(),
    395                               cc_->filename_data_.size(), index_key_, *indexes);
    396 
    397     if (count > indexes->size()) {
    398         for (auto it = cc_->files_.begin(); it < cc_->files_.end(); it++) {
    399             if (limiter_.exit_early()) {
    400                 return;
    401             }
    402             match_filename(it->get());
    403         }
    404         return;
    405     }
    406 
    407     lsd_radix_sort(indexes->data(), indexes->data() + count);
    408 
    409     // find candidate indexed_files from the positions of the candidate matches.
    410     // This is O(candidate_matches * log(indexed_files)), but it could probably
    411     // be done more cleverly in something like O(candidate_matches + log(indexed_files))
    412 
    413     // moving the left bound as we go isn't a big-O improvement, but may help a little bit.
    414     auto left_bound = cc_->filename_positions_.begin();
    415     int previous_first = -1;
    416 
    417     for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    418         if (limiter_.exit_early()) {
    419             break;
    420         }
    421 
    422         int target_index = (*indexes)[i];
    423         pair<int, indexed_file*> target(target_index, NULL);
    424         auto lb = lower_bound(left_bound, cc_->filename_positions_.end(), target);
    425 
    426         if (lb->first == previous_first) {
    427             // We have already returned this filename because of a match
    428             // earlier in its text.
    429             continue;
    430         }
    431         previous_first = lb->first;
    432 
    433         if (lb->first != target_index) {
    434             assert(lb == cc_->filename_positions_.end() ||
    435                    lb->first > target_index);
    436             assert(lb != left_bound);
    437             lb--;
    438         }
    439         assert(lb->first <= (*indexes)[i]);
    440         assert((*indexes)[i] < lb->first + lb->second->path.size());
    441         match_filename(lb->second);
    442 
    443         left_bound = lb;
    444     }
    445 }
    446 
    447 void filename_searcher::match_filename(indexed_file *file) {
    448     if (!accept(query_, file))
    449         return;
    450 
    451     StringPiece filepath = StringPiece(file->path);
    452     StringPiece match;
    453     if (!query_->line_pat->Match(filepath, 0, filepath.size(),
    454                                  RE2::UNANCHORED, &match, 1))
    455         return;
    456 
    457     file_result *f = new file_result;
    458     f->file = file;
    459     f->matchleft = utf8::distance(filepath.data(), match.data());
    460     f->matchright = f->matchleft + utf8::distance(match.data(), match.data() + match.size());
    461 
    462     queue_.push(f);
    463     limiter_.record_match();
    464 }
    465 
    466 code_searcher::code_searcher()
    467     : alloc_(), finalized_(false), filename_data_(), filename_suffixes_()
    468 {
    469 }
    470 
    471 void code_searcher::set_alloc(std::unique_ptr<chunk_allocator> alloc) {
    472     assert(!alloc_);
    473     alloc_ = move(alloc);
    474 }
    475 
    476 code_searcher::~code_searcher() {
    477     if (alloc_)
    478         alloc_->cleanup();
    479 }
    480 
    481 void code_searcher::index_filenames() {
    482     log("Building filename index...");
    483     filename_positions_.reserve(files_.size());
    484 
    485     size_t filename_data_size = 0;
    486     for (auto it = files_.begin(); it != files_.end(); ++it) {
    487         filename_data_size += (*it)->path.size() + 1;
    488     }
    489 
    490     filename_data_.resize(filename_data_size);
    491     int offset = 0;
    492     for (auto it = files_.begin(); it != files_.end(); ++it) {
    493         memcpy(filename_data_.data() + offset, (*it)->path.data(), (*it)->path.size());
    494         filename_data_[offset + (*it)->path.size()] = '\0';
    495         filename_positions_.emplace_back(offset, it->get());
    496         offset += (*it)->path.size() + 1;
    497     }
    498 
    499     filename_suffixes_.resize(filename_data_size);
    500     divsufsort(filename_data_.data(),
    501                reinterpret_cast<saidx_t*>(filename_suffixes_.data()),
    502                filename_data_size);
    503 }
    504 
    505 void code_searcher::finalize() {
    506     assert(!finalized_);
    507     finalized_ = true;
    508     index_filenames();
    509     alloc_->finalize();
    510 
    511     timeval now;
    512     gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
    513     index_timestamp_ = now.tv_sec;
    514 
    515     idx_data_chunks.inc(alloc_->end() - alloc_->begin());
    516     idx_content_chunks.inc(alloc_->end_content() - alloc_->begin_content());
    517 }
    518 
    519 vector<indexed_tree> code_searcher::trees() const {
    520     vector<indexed_tree> out;
    521     out.reserve(trees_.size());
    522     for (auto it = trees_.begin(); it != trees_.end(); ++it)
    523         out.push_back(**it);
    524     return out;
    525 }
    526 
    527 const indexed_tree* code_searcher::open_tree(const string &name,
    528                                              const Metadata &metadata,
    529                                              const string &version) {
    530     auto tree = std::make_unique<indexed_tree>();
    531     tree->name = name;
    532     tree->version = version;
    533     tree->metadata = metadata;
    534     trees_.push_back(move(tree));
    535     return trees_.back().get();
    536 }
    537 
    538 const indexed_tree* code_searcher::open_tree(const string &name,
    539                                              const string &version) {
    540     return open_tree(name, Metadata(), version);
    541 }
    542 
    543 void code_searcher::index_file(const indexed_tree *tree,
    544                                const string& path,
    545                                StringPiece contents) {
    546     assert(!finalized_);
    547     assert(alloc_);
    548     size_t len = contents.size();
    549     const char *p = contents.data();
    550     const char *end = p + len;
    551     const char *f;
    552     chunk *c;
    553     chunk *prev = NULL;
    554     StringPiece line;
    555 
    556     if (memchr(p, 0, len) != NULL)
    557         return;
    558 
    559     idx_bytes.inc(len);
    560     idx_files.inc();
    561 
    562     auto file = std::make_unique<indexed_file>();
    563     file->tree = tree;
    564     file->path = path;
    565     file->no  = files_.size();
    566     auto *sf = file.get();
    567     files_.push_back(move(file));
    568 
    569     uint32_t lines = count(p, end, '\n');
    570 
    571     file_contents_builder content;
    572 
    573     while ((f = static_cast<const char*>(memchr(p, '\n', end - p))) != 0) {
    574     final:
    575         idx_lines.inc();
    576         if (f - p + 1 >= FLAGS_line_limit) {
    577             // Don't index the long line, but do index an empty
    578             // line so that line number of future lines are
    579             // preserved.
    580             p = f;
    581         }
    582         decltype(lines_)::iterator it = lines_.end();
    583         if (FLAGS_compress) {
    584             it = lines_.find(StringPiece(p, f - p));
    585         }
    586         if (it == lines_.end()) {
    587             idx_bytes_dedup.inc((f - p) + 1);
    588             idx_lines_dedup.inc();
    589 
    590             unsigned char *alloc = alloc_->alloc(f - p + 1);
    591             memcpy(alloc, p, f - p);
    592             alloc[f - p] = '\n';
    593             line = StringPiece((char*)alloc, f - p);
    594             if (FLAGS_compress) {
    595                 if (alloc_->current_chunk() != prev)
    596                     lines_.clear();
    597                 lines_.insert(line);
    598             }
    599             prev = c = alloc_->current_chunk();
    600         } else {
    601             line = *it;
    602             c = alloc_->chunk_from_string
    603                 (reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(line.data()));
    604         }
    605         {
    606             c->add_chunk_file(sf, line);
    607         }
    608         content.extend(c, line);
    609         p = min(end, f + 1);
    610     }
    611     if (p < end - 1) {
    612         // Handle files with no trailing newline by jumping back and
    613         // adding the final line.
    614         assert(*(end-1) != '\n');
    615         f = end;
    616         lines++;
    617         goto final;
    618     }
    619 
    620     sf->content = content.build(alloc_.get());
    621     if (sf->content == 0) {
    622         fprintf(stderr, "WARN: %s:%s:%s is too large to be indexed.\n",
    623                 tree->name.c_str(), tree->version.c_str(), path.c_str());
    624         file_contents_builder dummy;
    625         sf->content = dummy.build(alloc_.get());
    626     }
    627     idx_content_ranges.inc(sf->content->size());
    628     assert(sf->content->size() <= 3*lines);
    629 
    630     for (auto it = alloc_->begin();
    631          it != alloc_->end(); it++) {
    632         (*it)->finish_file();
    633     }
    634 }
    635 
    636 bool searcher::should_search_chunk(const chunk *chunk) {
    637     if (!query_->tree_pat) {
    638         return true;
    639     }
    640 
    641     // skip chunks that don't contain any repos we're looking for
    642     for (auto it = chunk->tree_names.begin(); it != chunk->tree_names.end(); it++) {
    643         if (query_->tree_pat->Match(*it, 0,
    644                                     it->size(),
    645                                     RE2::UNANCHORED, 0, 0)) {
    646             return true;
    647         }
    648     }
    649     return false;
    650 }
    651 
    652 void searcher::operator()(const chunk *chunk)
    653 {
    654     if (limiter_.exit_early())
    655         return;
    656 
    657     if (!should_search_chunk(chunk))
    658         return;
    659 
    660     if (FLAGS_index && index_key_ && !index_key_->empty())
    661         filtered_search(chunk);
    662     else
    663         full_search(chunk);
    664 }
    665 
    666 struct walk_state {
    667     const uint32_t *left, *right;
    668     intrusive_ptr<QueryPlan> key;
    669     int depth;
    670 };
    671 
    672 struct lt_index {
    673     const unsigned char *data_;
    674     int idx_;
    675 
    676     bool operator()(uint32_t lhs, unsigned char rhs) {
    677         return cmp(lhs, rhs) < 0;
    678     }
    679 
    680     bool operator()(unsigned char lhs, uint32_t rhs) {
    681         return cmp(rhs, lhs) > 0;
    682     }
    683 
    684     int cmp(uint32_t lhs, unsigned char rhs) {
    685         unsigned char lc = data_[lhs + idx_];
    686         if (lc == '\n')
    687             return -1;
    688         return (int)lc - (int)rhs;
    689     }
    690 };
    691 
    692 int suffix_search(const unsigned char *data,
    693                   const uint32_t *suffixes,
    694                   int size,
    695                   intrusive_ptr<QueryPlan> index,
    696                   vector<uint32_t> &indexes_out) {
    697     int count = 0;
    698     vector<walk_state> stack;
    699     stack.push_back((walk_state){
    700             suffixes, suffixes + size, index, 0});
    701 
    702     while (!stack.empty()) {
    703         walk_state st = stack.back();
    704         stack.pop_back();
    705         if (!st.key || st.key->empty() || (st.right - st.left) <= 100) {
    706             if ((count + st.right - st.left) > indexes_out.size()) {
    707                 count = indexes_out.size() + 1;
    708                 break;
    709             }
    710             memcpy(&indexes_out[count], st.left,
    711                    (st.right - st.left) * sizeof(uint32_t));
    712             count += (st.right - st.left);
    713             continue;
    714         }
    715         lt_index lt = {data, st.depth};
    716         for (QueryPlan::iterator it = st.key->begin();
    717              it != st.key->end(); ++it) {
    718             const uint32_t *l, *r;
    719             l = lower_bound(st.left, st.right, it->first.first, lt);
    720             const uint32_t *right = lower_bound(l, st.right,
    721                                           (unsigned char)(it->first.second + 1),
    722                                           lt);
    723             if (l == right)
    724                 continue;
    725 
    726             if (st.depth)
    727                 assert(data[*l + st.depth - 1] ==
    728                        data[*(right - 1) + st.depth - 1]);
    729 
    730             assert(l == st.left ||
    731                    data[*(l-1) + st.depth] == '\n' ||
    732                    data[*(l-1) + st.depth] < it->first.first);
    733             assert(data[*l + st.depth] >= it->first.first);
    734             assert(right == st.right ||
    735                    data[*right + st.depth] > it->first.second);
    736 
    737             for (unsigned char ch = it->first.first; ch <= it->first.second;
    738                  ch++, l = r) {
    739                 r = lower_bound(l, right, (unsigned char)(ch + 1), lt);
    740 
    741                 if (r != l) {
    742                     stack.push_back((walk_state){l, r, it->second, st.depth + 1});
    743                 }
    744             }
    745         }
    746     }
    747     return count;
    748 }
    749 
    750 void searcher::filtered_search(const chunk *chunk)
    751 {
    752     static per_thread<vector<uint32_t> > indexes;
    753     if (!indexes.get()) {
    754         indexes.put(new vector<uint32_t>(cc_->alloc_->chunk_size() / kMinFilterRatio));
    755     }
    756     int count;
    757     {
    758         run_timer run(index_time_);
    759         count = suffix_search(chunk->data, chunk->suffixes, chunk->size, index_key_, *indexes);
    760     }
    761 
    762     search_lines(&(*indexes)[0], count, chunk);
    763 }
    764 
    765 struct match_finger {
    766     const chunk *chunk_;
    767     vector<chunk_file>::const_iterator it_;
    768     match_finger(const chunk *chunk) :
    769         chunk_(chunk), it_(chunk->files.begin()) {};
    770 };
    771 
    772 void searcher::search_lines(uint32_t *indexes, int count,
    773                             const chunk *chunk)
    774 {
    775     debug(kDebugProfile, "search_lines: Searching %d/%d indexes.", count, chunk->size);
    776 
    777     if (count == 0)
    778         return;
    779 
    780     if (count * kMinFilterRatio > chunk->size) {
    781         full_search(chunk);
    782         return;
    783     }
    784 
    785     if ((query_->file_pat || query_->tree_pat) &&
    786         double(count * 30) / chunk->size > files_density()) {
    787         full_search(chunk);
    788         return;
    789     }
    790 
    791     {
    792         run_timer run(sort_time_);
    793         lsd_radix_sort(indexes, indexes + count);
    794     }
    795 
    796     match_finger finger(chunk);
    797 
    798     StringPiece search((char*)chunk->data, chunk->size);
    799     uint32_t max = indexes[0];
    800     uint32_t min = line_start(chunk, indexes[0]);
    801     for (int i = 0; i <= count && !limiter_.exit_early(); i++) {
    802         if (i != count) {
    803             if (indexes[i] < max) continue;
    804             if (indexes[i] < max + kMinSkip) {
    805                 max = indexes[i];
    806                 continue;
    807             }
    808         }
    809 
    810         int end = line_end(chunk, max);
    811         full_search(&finger, chunk, min, end);
    812 
    813         if (i != count) {
    814             max = indexes[i];
    815             min = line_start(chunk, max);
    816         }
    817     }
    818 }
    819 
    820 void searcher::full_search(const chunk *chunk)
    821 {
    822     match_finger finger(chunk);
    823     full_search(&finger, chunk, 0, chunk->size - 1);
    824 }
    825 
    826 void searcher::next_range(match_finger *finger,
    827                           int& pos, int& endpos, int maxpos)
    828 {
    829     if ((!query_->file_pat && !query_->tree_pat) || !FLAGS_index)
    830         return;
    831 
    832     debug(kDebugSearch, "next_range(%d, %d, %d)", pos, endpos, maxpos);
    833 
    834     vector<chunk_file>::const_iterator& it = finger->it_;
    835     const vector<chunk_file>::const_iterator& end = finger->chunk_->files.end();
    836 
    837     /* Find the first matching range that intersects [pos, maxpos) */
    838     while (it != end &&
    839            (it->right < pos || !accept(query_, it->files)) &&
    840            it->left < maxpos)
    841         ++it;
    842 
    843     if (it == end || it->left >= maxpos) {
    844         pos = endpos = maxpos;
    845         return;
    846     }
    847 
    848     pos    = max(pos, it->left);
    849     endpos = it->right;
    850 
    851     /*
    852      * Now scan until we either:
    853      * - prove that [pos, maxpos) is all in range,
    854      * - find a gap greater than kMinSkip, or
    855      * - pass maxpos entirely.
    856      */
    857     do {
    858         if (it->left >= endpos + kMinSkip)
    859             break;
    860         if (it->right >= endpos && accept(query_, it->files)) {
    861             endpos = max(endpos, it->right);
    862             if (endpos >= maxpos)
    863                 /*
    864                  * We've accepted the entire range. No point in going on.
    865                  */
    866                 break;
    867         }
    868         ++it;
    869     } while (it != end && it->left < maxpos);
    870 
    871     endpos = min(endpos, maxpos);
    872 }
    873 
    874 void searcher::full_search(match_finger *finger,
    875                            const chunk *chunk, size_t minpos, size_t maxpos)
    876 {
    877     StringPiece str((char*)chunk->data, chunk->size);
    878     StringPiece match;
    879     int pos = minpos, new_pos, end = minpos;
    880     while (pos < maxpos && !limiter_.exit_early()) {
    881         if (pos >= end) {
    882             end = maxpos;
    883             next_range(finger, pos, end, maxpos);
    884             assert(pos <= end);
    885         }
    886         if (pos >= maxpos)
    887             break;
    888 
    889         debug(kDebugSearch, "[%p] range:%d-%d/%d-%d",
    890               (void*)(chunk), pos, end, int(minpos), int(maxpos));
    891 
    892         {
    893             int limit = end;
    894             if (limit - pos > kMaxScan)
    895                 limit = line_end(chunk, pos + kMaxScan);
    896             run_timer run(re2_time_);
    897             if (!query_->line_pat->Match(str, pos, limit, RE2::UNANCHORED, &match, 1)) {
    898                 pos = limit + 1;
    899                 continue;
    900             }
    901         }
    902         assert(memchr(match.data(), '\n', match.size()) == NULL);
    903         StringPiece line = find_line(str, match);
    904         if (utf8::is_valid(line.data(), line.data() + line.size()))
    905             find_match(chunk, match, line);
    906         new_pos = line.size() + line.data() - str.data() + 1;
    907         assert(new_pos > pos);
    908         pos = new_pos;
    909     }
    910 }
    911 
    912 void searcher::find_match_brute(const chunk *chunk,
    913                                 const StringPiece& match,
    914                                 const StringPiece& line) {
    915     run_timer run(git_time_);
    916     timer tm;
    917     int off = (unsigned char*)line.data() - chunk->data;
    918     int searched = 0;
    919 
    920     for(vector<chunk_file>::const_iterator it = chunk->files.begin();
    921         it != chunk->files.end(); it++) {
    922         if (off >= it->left && off <= it->right) {
    923             for (list<indexed_file *>::const_iterator fit = it->files.begin();
    924                  fit != it->files.end(); ++fit) {
    925                 if (!accept(query_, *fit))
    926                     continue;
    927                 searched++;
    928                 if (limiter_.exit_early())
    929                     break;
    930                 try_match(line, match, *fit);
    931             }
    932         }
    933     }
    934 
    935     tm.pause();
    936     debug(kDebugProfile, "Searched %d files in %d.%06ds",
    937           searched,
    938           int(tm.elapsed().tv_sec),
    939           int(tm.elapsed().tv_usec));
    940 }
    941 
    942 void searcher::find_match(const chunk *chunk,
    943                           const StringPiece& match,
    944                           const StringPiece& line) {
    945     if (!FLAGS_index) {
    946         find_match_brute(chunk, match, line);
    947         return;
    948     }
    949 
    950     run_timer run(git_time_);
    951     int loff = (unsigned char*)line.data() - chunk->data;
    952 
    953     vector<chunk_file_node *> stack;
    954     assert(chunk->cf_root);
    955     stack.push_back(chunk->cf_root.get());
    956 
    957     debug(kDebugSearch, "find_match(%d)", loff);
    958 
    959     while (!stack.empty() && !limiter_.exit_early()) {
    960         chunk_file_node *n = stack.back();
    961         stack.pop_back();
    962 
    963         debug(kDebugSearch,
    964               "walk <%d-%d> - %d", n->chunk->left, n->chunk->right,
    965               n->right_limit);
    966 
    967         if (loff > n->right_limit)
    968             continue;
    969         if (loff >= n->chunk->left) {
    970             if (n->right)
    971                 stack.push_back(n->right.get());
    972             if (loff <= n->chunk->right) {
    973                 debug(kDebugSearch, "visit <%d-%d>", n->chunk->left, n->chunk->right);
    974                 assert(loff >= n->chunk->left && loff <= n->chunk->right);
    975                 for (list<indexed_file *>::const_iterator it = n->chunk->files.begin();
    976                      it != n->chunk->files.end(); ++it) {
    977                     if (!accept(query_, *it))
    978                         continue;
    979                     if (limiter_.exit_early())
    980                         break;
    981                     try_match(line, match, *it);
    982                 }
    983             }
    984         }
    985         if (n->left)
    986             stack.push_back(n->left.get());
    987     }
    988 }
    989 
    990 
    991 void searcher::try_match(const StringPiece& line,
    992                          const StringPiece& match,
    993                          indexed_file *sf) {
    994 
    995     int lno = 1;
    996     auto it = sf->content->begin(cc_->alloc_.get());
    997 
    998     while (true) {
    999         for (;it != sf->content->end(cc_->alloc_.get()); ++it) {
   1000             if (line.data() >= it->data() &&
   1001                 line.data() <= it->data() + it->size()) {
   1002                 lno += count(it->data(), line.data(), '\n');
   1003                 break;
   1004             } else {
   1005                 lno += count(it->data(), it->data() + it->size(), '\n') + 1;
   1006             }
   1007         }
   1008 
   1009         debug(kDebugSearch, "found match on %s:%d", sf->path.c_str(), lno);
   1010 
   1011         if (it == sf->content->end(cc_->alloc_.get()))
   1012             return;
   1013 
   1014         match_result *m = new match_result;
   1015         m->file = sf;
   1016         m->lno  = lno;
   1017         m->line = line;
   1018         m->matchleft = utf8::distance(line.data(), match.data());
   1019         m->matchright = m->matchleft +
   1020             utf8::distance(match.data(), match.data() + match.size());
   1021 
   1022         // iterators for forward and backward context
   1023         auto fit = it, bit = it;
   1024         StringPiece l = line;
   1025         int i = 0;
   1026 
   1027         for (i = 0; i < query_->context_lines; i++) {
   1028             if (l.data() == bit->data()) {
   1029                 if (bit == sf->content->begin(cc_->alloc_.get()))
   1030                     break;
   1031                 --bit;
   1032                 l = StringPiece(bit->data() + bit->size() + 1, 0);
   1033             }
   1034             l = find_line(*bit, StringPiece(l.data() - 1, 0));
   1035             m->context_before.push_back(l);
   1036         }
   1037 
   1038         l = line;
   1039 
   1040         for (i = 0; i < query_->context_lines; i++) {
   1041             if (l.data() + l.size() == fit->data() + fit->size()) {
   1042                 if (++fit == sf->content->end(cc_->alloc_.get()))
   1043                     break;
   1044                 l = StringPiece(fit->data() - 1, 0);
   1045             }
   1046             l = find_line(*fit, StringPiece(l.data() + l.size() + 1, 0));
   1047             m->context_after.push_back(l);
   1048         }
   1049 
   1050         if (!transform_ || transform_(m)) {
   1051             queue_.push(m);
   1052             limiter_.record_match();
   1053         }
   1054         if (limiter_.exit_early())
   1055             break;
   1056 
   1057         ++it;
   1058         ++lno;
   1059     }
   1060 }
   1061 
   1062 code_searcher::search_thread::search_thread(code_searcher *cs)
   1063     : cs_(cs) {
   1064     if (FLAGS_search) {
   1065         for (int i = 0; i < FLAGS_threads; ++i) {
   1066             threads_.emplace_back(search_one, this);
   1067         }
   1068         threads_.emplace_back(search_file_one, this);
   1069     }
   1070 }
   1071 
   1072 void code_searcher::search_thread::match(const query &q,
   1073                                          const callback_func& cb,
   1074                                          const file_callback_func& fcb,
   1075                                          const transform_func& func,
   1076                                          match_stats *stats) {
   1077     match_result *m;
   1078     file_result *f;
   1079     int matches = 0, file_matches = 0;
   1080 
   1081     assert(cs_->finalized_);
   1082 
   1083     if (!FLAGS_search) {
   1084         return;
   1085     }
   1086 
   1087     if (FLAGS_drop_cache) {
   1088         cs_->alloc_->drop_caches();
   1089     }
   1090 
   1091     timer analyze_time(false);
   1092     intrusive_ptr<QueryPlan> index_key;
   1093     {
   1094         run_timer run(analyze_time);
   1095         index_key = constructQueryPlan(*q.line_pat);
   1096     }
   1097     debug(kDebugProfile, "analyze time: %d.%06ds",
   1098           int(analyze_time.elapsed().tv_sec),
   1099           int(analyze_time.elapsed().tv_usec));
   1100 
   1101     searcher search(cs_, q, index_key, func);
   1102     filename_searcher file_search(cs_, q, index_key);
   1103     job j;
   1104     j.trace_id = current_trace_id();
   1105     j.search = &search;
   1106     j.file_search = &file_search;
   1107     j.pending = 0;
   1108 
   1109     if (!q.filename_only) {
   1110         for (int i = 0; i < FLAGS_threads; ++i) {
   1111             ++j.pending;
   1112             queue_.push(&j);
   1113         }
   1114 
   1115         for (auto it = cs_->alloc_->begin(); it != cs_->alloc_->end(); it++) {
   1116             j.chunks.push(*it);
   1117         }
   1118         j.chunks.close();
   1119     }
   1120 
   1121     file_queue_.push(&j);
   1122 
   1123     if (!q.filename_only) {
   1124         while (search.queue_.pop(&m)) {
   1125             matches++;
   1126             cb(m);
   1127             delete m;
   1128         }
   1129     }
   1130 
   1131     while (file_search.queue_.pop(&f)) {
   1132         file_matches++;
   1133         fcb(f);
   1134         delete f;
   1135     }
   1136 
   1137     if (q.filename_only) {
   1138         stats->why = file_search.why();
   1139         stats->matches += file_matches;
   1140     } else {
   1141         search.get_stats(stats);
   1142         stats->why = search.why();
   1143         stats->matches += matches;
   1144     }
   1145 
   1146     struct timeval t = analyze_time.elapsed();
   1147     timeradd(&stats->analyze_time, &t, &stats->analyze_time);
   1148 }
   1149 
   1150 
   1151 code_searcher::search_thread::~search_thread() {
   1152     queue_.close();
   1153     file_queue_.close();
   1154     for (auto it = threads_.begin(); it != threads_.end(); ++it)
   1155         it->join();
   1156 }
   1157 
   1158 void code_searcher::search_thread::search_one(search_thread *me) {
   1159     job *j;
   1160     while (me->queue_.pop(&j)) {
   1161         scoped_trace_id trace(j->trace_id);
   1162 
   1163         chunk *c;
   1164         while (j->chunks.pop(&c)) {
   1165             (*j->search)(c);
   1166         }
   1167 
   1168         if (--j->pending == 0)
   1169             j->search->queue_.close();
   1170     }
   1171 }
   1172 
   1173 void code_searcher::search_thread::search_file_one(search_thread *me) {
   1174     job *j;
   1175     while (me->file_queue_.pop(&j)) {
   1176         scoped_trace_id trace(j->trace_id);
   1177         (*j->file_search)();
   1178         j->file_search->queue_.close();
   1179     }
   1180 }
   1181 
   1182 void default_re2_options(RE2::Options &opts) {
   1183     opts.set_never_nl(true);
   1184     opts.set_one_line(false);
   1185     opts.set_perl_classes(true);
   1186     opts.set_word_boundary(true);
   1187     opts.set_posix_syntax(true);
   1188     opts.set_word_boundary(true);
   1189     opts.set_log_errors(false);
   1190 }
